newsitem.title: UK: Croda Intl says strong stg hits Q1 profits.
newsitem.headline: Croda Intl says strong stg hits Q1 profits.

text.p: British speciality chemicals group Croda International warned on Thursday that the strength of the pound had reduced the group's total sales value in the first quarter by about 8.0 million stg while its profits had been reduced by about two million stg.

"We estimate that this unwelcome strength has reduced total sales and profits which we would otherwise have made in the first quarter by about 8.0 million and 2.0 million stg respectively," the company said in a statement.
Croda said it manufactured about two-thirds of its products in the UK and sold about the same proportion into overseas markets.

The company, however, said that the growth in the global chemicals sector and the specialised nature of Croda's products had helped it to notch sales volume and profits of about 96 percent of last year's figures.
